persona.name: Oron Afek
persona.persona: Triathlete optimizing iron status & endurance performance
persona.narrative: Elite-level triathlete with exceptional VO2peak (52 ml/min/kg) but critically low iron status threatening performance. 9+ years of GPS workout data reveal training patterns driving iron depletion.

insights.title: Training Volume → Iron Status
insights.headline: Your running volume is depleting iron stores — this is your #1 health risk
insights.recommendation: Reduce running volume below 40 km/week or supplement iron (consult physician for IV iron given severity)
insights.explanation: Foot-strike hemolysis destroys red blood cells during high-volume running. Your iron dropped from 63 to 37 mcg/dL (ref: 50-180), which is critically low. At your current weekly volume, you are losing iron faster than dietary intake can replace.
insights.whyNow: Iron at 37 mcg/dL is below reference range (50-180). Iron saturation at 9.3% vs ref 20-48%.
insights.suggestedAction: Reduce running volume below 40 km/week or supplement iron (consult physician for IV iron given severity)
insights.showWork: Fit piecewise-linear model: iron ~ f(weekly_run_km) with changepoint at θ. Below θ: mild decline (-0.20 mcg/dL per 10 km). Above θ: steep decline (-0.80 mcg/dL per 10 km). Prior: Sim et al., Sports Med 2019. Personal data: 2 observation pairs. Evidence split: 6% personal / 94% population.
insights.disclaimer: This marker is approaching a clinical threshold. Consider discussing with your healthcare provider.

insights.title: Zone 2 Volume → Triglycerides
insights.headline: Your aerobic training is keeping triglycerides excellent
insights.recommendation: Maintain 146+ min/week of Zone 2 training to sustain low triglycerides
insights.explanation: Regular Zone 2 exercise activates lipoprotein lipase, clearing triglycerides. Your TG at 42 mg/dL is excellent (<150 optimal, <100 ideal).
insights.whyNow: Triglycerides at 42 mg/dL — exceptional. Your Zone 2 training is working.
insights.suggestedAction: Maintain 146+ min/week of Zone 2 training to sustain low triglycerides
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: triglycerides ~ f(weekly_zone2_min). θ = 146 min/wk. Prior: AHA guidelines. Evidence: 12% personal / 88% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Training Load → Testosterone
insights.headline: Training hours may be suppressing testosterone — monitor closely
insights.recommendation: Keep total training below 12 hours/week; prioritize recovery weeks
insights.explanation: Overtraining suppresses the HPG axis, lowering testosterone. Your levels (327-444 ng/dL) are lower-normal for age 43. High training volume without adequate recovery exacerbates this.
insights.whyNow: Testosterone 327-444 ng/dL, lower quartile for age. Training volume is high.
insights.suggestedAction: Keep total training below 12 hours/week; prioritize recovery weeks
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: testosterone ~ f(weekly_training_hrs). θ = 11.6 hrs/wk. Prior: Hackney et al., BJSM 2003. Evidence: 9% personal / 91% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Training Volume → Ferritin Stores
insights.headline: Ferritin improving (24→46) but still suboptimal for endurance performance
insights.recommendation: Target ferritin >50 ng/mL. Keep running below 36 km/week while repleting stores
insights.explanation: Ferritin reflects total body iron stores. Yours hit a critical low of 24 ng/mL (ref: 38-380) and has improved to 46 — still below the 50+ ng/mL target for athletes. Endurance performance is impaired when ferritin drops below 30 ng/mL.
insights.whyNow: Ferritin at 46 ng/mL, improving from 24 but not yet in athlete-optimal range (>50).
insights.suggestedAction: Target ferritin >50 ng/mL. Keep running below 36 km/week while repleting stores
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: ferritin ~ f(weekly_run_km). θ = 36 km/wk. Prior: Peeling et al., IJSNEM 2008. Evidence: 6% personal / 94% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Zone 2 Volume → HDL Cholesterol
insights.headline: HDL at 44 — could benefit from more consistent Zone 2
insights.recommendation: Target 146+ min/week Zone 2 to raise HDL above 50 mg/dL
insights.explanation: HDL at 44 mg/dL is adequate but not protective (>50 preferred for men). Consistent Zone 2 training is the most effective non-pharmacological HDL booster.
insights.whyNow: HDL at 44 mg/dL, below the 50+ target. Zone 2 volume may be insufficient.
insights.suggestedAction: Target 146+ min/week Zone 2 to raise HDL above 50 mg/dL
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: hdl ~ f(weekly_zone2_min). θ = 146 min/wk. Prior: AHA guidelines. Evidence: 12% personal / 88% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Training Load Ratio → Inflammation
insights.headline: Inflammation excellently controlled — maintain ACWR balance
insights.recommendation: Keep ACWR below 1.3 to maintain hsCRP under 1.0 mg/L
insights.explanation: hsCRP at 0.3 mg/L indicates minimal systemic inflammation — outstanding for an athlete. Acute overreaching (ACWR >1.3) can spike inflammation. Your current load management is working well.
insights.whyNow: hsCRP stable at 0.3-0.4 mg/L. Maintain current training load management.
insights.suggestedAction: Keep ACWR below 1.3 to maintain hsCRP under 1.0 mg/L
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: hscrp ~ f(acwr). θ = 1.25. Prior: Hulin et al., BJSM 2016. Evidence: 12% personal / 88% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Training Consistency → VO2 Peak
insights.headline: VO2peak at 52 ml/min/kg (excellent) — consistency is paying off
insights.recommendation: Maintain training consistency above 60% of days to protect VO2peak
insights.explanation: Your VO2peak of 52 ml/min/kg is rated excellent (129% of predicted). This is driven by consistent training over years. However, iron deficiency threatens O2 transport capacity — address iron first.
insights.whyNow: VO2peak excellent at 52. Iron deficiency could erode this if not addressed.
insights.suggestedAction: Maintain training consistency above 60% of days to protect VO2peak
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: vo2_peak ~ f(training_consistency). θ = 0.60. Prior: General exercise physiology. Evidence: 0% personal / 100% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

insights.title: Iron Stores → Performance Ceiling
insights.headline: Low ferritin is capping your aerobic performance potential
insights.recommendation: Raise ferritin above 30 ng/mL to unlock full VO2peak
insights.explanation: Ferritin below 30 ng/mL impairs hemoglobin synthesis, limiting oxygen delivery. Despite excellent VO2peak (52), your iron saturation of 9.3% means O2 transport is already compromised. Fixing iron could yield further performance gains.
insights.whyNow: Iron saturation at 9.3% (ref 20-48%) is the bottleneck limiting further adaptation.
insights.suggestedAction: Raise ferritin above 30 ng/mL to unlock full VO2peak
insights.showWork: Piecewise-linear: vo2_peak ~ f(ferritin). θ = 30 ng/mL. Prior: DellaValle & Haas, MSSE 2014. Evidence: 0% personal / 100% population.
insights.disclaimer: Insights are derived from your personal data combined with population research. They do not constitute medical advice.

protocols.name: Iron Repletion Protocol
protocols.title: Replete Iron Stores While Maintaining Fitness
protocols.description: Reduce running volume temporarily, add iron supplementation, retest in 8 weeks
protocols.outcome: Iron >50 mcg/dL, Ferritin >50 ng/mL, Iron Saturation >20%

actions.label: Take vitamin C with iron for absorption

triggers.reason: Iron at 37 mcg/dL requires active intervention

protocols.expectedImpact: Iron >50 mcg/dL, improved O2 delivery, better endurance

protocols.name: Omega-3 Optimization
protocols.title: Optimize Omega-3 Index & Reduce AA/EPA Ratio
protocols.description: Supplement EPA/DHA to improve omega-3 index and reduce inflammatory omega-6/omega-3 ratio
protocols.personalizedTiming: 4-8 weeks to see meaningful ratio change
protocols.expectedImpact: Reduced inflammation, improved recovery, better endothelial function

dailyPlan.greeting: Good morning, Oron. Your iron status remains critical at 37 mcg/dL. Today's focus: manage training volume while supporting iron repletion.
